questions.text: Identify the incision shown in the given image.
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Rosen's endomeatal incision is used for stapes surgery in Otosclerosis.
  • Location: Made inside the ear canal (endomeatal).
  • Purpose: Commonly used in stapedectomy and tympanoplasty.

Explanation of other options:

Lempert's Endaural Incision(Option A):

  • Location: Starts at the superior part of the external auditory canal and extends to the tragus.
  • Purpose: Used in endaural approaches for mastoid surgery or tympanoplasty.

Myringotomy Incision(Option C):

  • Location: A small incision is made directly in the tympanic membrane (eardrum).
  • Purpose: For relieving pressure or draining fluid from the middle ear (e.g., in otitis media); often accompanied by insertion of ventilation (grommet) tubes.
  • In the image below, C is a curved incision, and R is a radial incision.

Wilde's Postaural Incision(Option D):

  • Location: Made behind the ear (postauricular region).
  • Purpose: Provides wide access to the mastoid and middle ear spaces in mastoidectomy and other extensive ear surgeries.

choices.text: Polish the area with a diamond burr
Apply a cutting burr to the site of bleeding
Use electrocautery to control the bleeding
Use bone wax to control the bleeding

questions.text: A surgeon, while doing mastoid surgery, encounters unusual bleeding in the operative site. He can control the bleeding by doing everything except
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Applying a cutting burr to the site of bleeding can, in turn, cause penetrating trauma.
  • Polishing the area with a diamond burr reduces heat and does not produce much trauma. (Option A ruled out)
  • Electrocautery helps in reducing the bleeding from the vessels and hence controls haemorrhage. (Option C ruled out)
  • Bone wax is commonly used to tamponade bleeding from bone (e.g., diploic vessels or emissary veins). Especially helpful in oozing from the mastoid cortex.(Option D ruled out)

questions.text: Which focal length in the objective piece of the microscope is commonly used for ear surgery?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The focal length of the objective piece of the microscope commonly used in ENT is:

  • Ear surgery-200/250mm
  • Nose-300mm
  • Larynx-400mm

questions.text:
True statement regarding the use of the head mirror & Bull lamp in ENT examination:
a. The distance between the doctor and the patient must be more than 10 inches
b. Applied on the right eye
c. The right eye should be closed during examination
d. Both eyes should be open while examining
e. Light from the bull lamp is diffuse but strong
questions.solution:
Explanation:

Head mirror and Bull lamp in ENT:

  • The distance between the doctor and the patient must be less than 10 inches
  • Applied to the right eye
  • Both eyes should be open while examining
  • The light is diffuse but strong

choices.text: Objects located medial to the isthmus of the canal are difficult to remove
Every attempt should be made to catch the insect alive
A Blunt hook is used to remove a rounded foreign body
General anaesthesia is preferred in children to remove a foreign body

questions.text: All is true about foreign body impaction in the ear except:
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • A live insect can cause severe pain, panic, and tympanic membrane injury.
  • First, kill the insect (e.g., by instilling alcohol, oil, or lidocaine) before attempting removal.

Other options:

  • The isthmus is the narrowest part of the external auditory canal (EAC), located about 0.5-1 cm from the tympanic membrane. Foreign bodies medial to the isthmus are closer to the tympanic membrane, making them harder to access and remove safely. (Option A)
  • A blunt hook or right-angle hook is commonly used to gently scoop out rounded or smooth foreign bodies that do not have a graspable edge. (Option C)
  • In children, especially uncooperative ones, general anaesthesia (GA) is often preferred to avoid trauma to the ear canal or tympanic membrane during foreign body removal. (Option D)

questions.text: Identify which surgery has been done in the following picture?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • The above image shows Stapedectomy with prosthesis insertion.
  • Stapes prostheses are used in the stapedectomy surgery procedure, which aims to improve conductive hearing loss due to oval window closure secondary to otosclerosis or post-inflammatory conditions.

Contraindications of the surgery:

  • Only hearing ear (in most cases)
  • Active otitis media or chronic otorrhea
  • Uncontrolled vertigo or Meniere's disease
  • Poor general health/unfit for surgery
  • Uncooperative patient
  • Congenital fixation or anomalous facial nerve course

choices.text: Just below the level of Donaldson's line
Just above the level of Donaldson's line

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the surgical landmark of the Endolymphatic sac for surgery in Intractable Meniere's disease?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Donaldson's line passes through the horizontal canal and bisects the posterior canal.
  • It is a landmark for the endolymphatic sac, which lies anterior and inferior to it.
